name: Krishna Aarti
title: Aarti Kunj Bihari Ki
description: A beautiful aarti dedicated to Lord Krishna, the supreme personality of Godhead who represents divine love, wisdom, and joy. This aarti is performed during Janmashtami and other Krishna festivals.
significance: Invokes Lord Krishna's blessings for divine love, spiritual wisdom, and joy in life.

seo.description: Complete Krishna Aarti with lyrics in Hindi and English, meaning, and significance. Learn the proper way to perform Lord Krishna aarti.

sections.title: Lord Krishna Aarti
sections.content: The Krishna Aarti is a beautiful devotional hymn that praises Lord Krishna, the divine cowherd who mesmerizes all with his flute and divine love.

sections.title: Historical Significance
sections.content: This aarti has been sung for centuries in Vaishnavite tradition. It is especially significant during Janmashtami when Krishna's birth is celebrated.

sections.title: Complete Aarti Lyrics
sections.content: The complete lyrics of Krishna Aarti in Hindi with English translation.

subsections.title: Hindi Lyrics
subsections.english:
Aarti of Kunj Bihari, Shri Giridhar Krishna Murari
Aarti of Kunj Bihari

Wearing a garland of basil leaves, playing the sweet flute
Earrings shining in ears, joy of Nanda, beloved Nandlala
Wearing a garland of basil leaves, playing the sweet flute

Body dark like the sky, Radhika shines beside
Standing gracefully in the garden
Curls like bees, musk tilak, moon-like glow
Standing gracefully in the garden

Beautiful form of beloved Shyama, Shri Giridhar Krishna Murari
Aarti of Kunj Bihari
subsections.meaning: This aarti glorifies Lord Krishna as the one who wanders through the gardens of Vrindavan, enchanting all with his divine beauty and flute.

sections.title: How to Perform the Aarti
sections.content: Proper method and rituals for performing Krishna Aarti.

subsections.title: Preparation
subsections.content: Clean the worship area, arrange a thali with diya, butter, makhan, flute, and flowers. Place Krishna idol or picture facing east.

subsections.title: Aarti Procedure
subsections.content: Offer butter and makhan to Krishna, light the diya, and perform the aarti while moving it in circular motion. Sing with devotion and play Krishna bhajans.

sections.title: Spiritual Significance
sections.content: Understanding the deeper meaning and benefits of performing Krishna Aarti.

subsections.title: Divine Love
subsections.content: The aarti helps in developing divine love (prem) and devotion towards the supreme personality of Godhead.

subsections.title: Spiritual Joy
subsections.content: Regular performance of this aarti brings spiritual joy, peace, and liberation from worldly sorrows.
